project.teaser: Sustainable bioeconomy transition is an acknowledged pathfinder to achieve the Green Deal ambitions. A regionalised bioeconomy is seen as a promising leverage point for green growth. Many European regions have already adopted bioeconomy strategies. However, the majority of...
project.objective: Sustainable bioeconomy transition is an acknowledged pathfinder to achieve the Green Deal ambitions. A regionalised bioeconomy is seen as a promising leverage point for green growth. Many European regions have already adopted bioeconomy strategies. However, the majority of regional stakeholders lack actionable knowledge to translate them into practice and embed them into society, industry and research by simultaneously considering planetary boundaries. Regions heavily relying on GHG-intensive economies - that are particularly critical for realising the Green Deal - face even more challenges to unlock their bioeconomy potential. The concept of bioeconomy model regions tackles the urgent need to concretise bioeconomy into tangible transition measures. Model regions are characterized by a systemic approach, draw on technological and societal innovations, are able to link sectors and contribute to sustainable development in economic, ecological and social dimensions. BIO2REG therefore aims to enable regional stakeholders of GHG-intensive economies to unlock their regions’ bioeconomy potential by transitioning towards model regions. BIO2REG paves the way for regional stakeholder to actively initiate and shape transition based on a regions-to-regions approach. Embedded in a network of regions for regions, interregional exchange and cooperation will be facilitated. Specifically, regional stakeholders will be capacitated by i) provision of a regionalisation concept for model regions, ii) mapping best practices on circular and sustainable bioeconomy, iii) guides for bioeconomy potential assessments, iv) mentoring and training services v) formation of transition alliances and v) policy recommendations to adapt strategies and funding. A key component is the adoption of a multi-actor approach by co-creating tools and guides with regional stakeholders as well as engaging with regions by guided on-site exchanges with stakeholders from other regions.
project.title: Enabling transition towards circular and systemic BIOeconomy model regions by a Regions-to-Regions approach
project.keywords: green transition, bioeconomy model region, bioeconomy regionalisation, GHG-intensive economies, green growth, multi-actor approach, sustainable bioeconomy

article.title: Assisting greenhouse gas-intensive regions transition to a regional bioeconomy

result.title: Guide for regional stakeholders to implement regional MCA framework assessment
result.description: This deliverable reporting on T1.3 activities contains a guide on how to implement the MCA framework assessment targeting regional stakeholders and applicable to the diversity of European bioeconomy regions and their regional specificities and different GHG-intensive economies. Dimensions of the MCA refer to e.g. products, industries, sectors and their cross-sectoral integration. PU compiles D1.3.

result.title: Project website
result.description: D4.2 delivers the BIO2REG project website related to T4.2. BIOC is responsible for delivering the website.

result.title: Concept note on technical and logistical support for HORIZON-CL6-2024-CircBio-01-7
result.description: This deliverable contains all technical and logistical support services to be offered to HORIZON-CL6-2024-CircBio-01-7 related to T6.3 compiled by FZJ supported by KVC, PU and BIOC. The offered services derive from exchanges in the context of the bi-monthly Jour Fixes with regards to identified support need for the IA solutions as well as regions' conditions, specificities and individual challenges to transform into bioeconomy model regions.

result.title: Database of user-friendly tools for regional cooperation towards circular and systemic bioeconomy model regions
result.description: This deliverable reporting on T2.2 activities lists and evaluates existing IT tools for regional cooperations and will be uploaded to the project website. D2.2 is compiled by KVC and supported by FZJ.

result.title: BIO2REG regionalization concept for circular and systemic bioeconomy model regions
result.description: This deliverable reports on T1.1 activties and contains the regionalization concept to develop circular and systemic bioeconomy model regions. The regionalization concept will consider regional specificities with regards to e.g. economic structure, quantity and quality of biological resources, agricultural and industrial structure, conditions and requirements for protection of natural resources etc. FZJ is responsible for D1.1 supported by all partners.

result.title: 1st annual meeting and its minutes
result.description: This deliverable related to T6.1 compiled by FZJ supported by KVC, PU and BIOC reports on the 1st annual meeting.

result.title: Bioeconomy as a driver of sustainable regional development in Greece & Europe
Report on final concept of BIO2REG network
result.description: This deliverable reports on T2.1 activties and contains the final concept of the BIO2REG network. KVC is mainly responsible for D2.1 with support of all consortium partners.

result.title: Five Call-to-Action videos
result.description: BIOC delivers five short Call-to-Action videos (D4.3 related to T4.3) summarizing results of the expert workshops implemented in T1.4.

result.title: Initial data management plan
result.description: This deliverable related to T6.2 compiled by FZJ contains the initial data management plan.

result.title: Public summary on guides for regional stakeholders on transition measures towards bioeconomy model regions based on best practices

FZJ is responsible for D1.5 supported by KVC, RISE, MATIS, HSE, BHCZ and BIC.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
